inn1.comm: back of a length on off to start, hardly any swing. Won't get much movement with that length anyway. Chari gets on top of the bounce to keep it down
nice carry. Hits a back of a length outside off, gets it to rise but it is wide enough for Chari to leave
back of a length again, 140 kph. Gets this to seam back in enough. Left again. Maybe setting him up with one that is full and swinging
still on a back of a length, on off. Chari gets a thick inside edge towards square leg for a run
beauty. The first ball that is full and it beats the bat. Full delivery outside off, the ball holds its line. Chamu gets his foot to the ball rather late.
back of a length outside off, short and wide actually. Chamu misses his cut.
full and gets some away shape. 133 kph. Chari strides forward and steers his drive to backward point
full again outside off, a bit of movement. Nothing prodigious. Blocked to cover
wow, that is exuberant. Good length on a fourth-stump channel. Chari shimmies down and hits only air in his cross-batted swat through midwicket
nice and full again, driven to cover with an angled bat. Excellent length for this time of day
covers the length, moves across and guides the ball to point. A bit of a forward movement
well bowled. Sees Chari shuffling across, and tries to hit that exposed leg stump. Misses and is called wide. But that's fine.
134 kph, full on off, a bit of movement. Solidly blocked to cover
strays down leg, nudged to fine leg
144 kph, rather full on off. Blocked to cover. Not much movement for Gabriel so far
oh, what happened there? Back of a length outside off, the ball jags back in prodigiously and misses Chari's body. Whew, that moved.
sticks with a back of a length outside off, punched on the up towards cover. The fielder misfields sloppily and allows one
nicely played. Short from Gabriel on off, Chamu pulls over square leg, and doesn't keep it down. Good stroke. Stops in the lush outfield as square leg scampers after it. Three
a lovely yorker to end. Speared in on off. Chari jams his bat down in time
nicely bowled. Full way outside off, but a drive-able length. Chamu plays an excellent leave
lovely bowling. A fuller than good length just outside. Moving away. Another superb leave. Excellent cricket
back of a length outside off, Chamu goes back and punches to mid-off
goes straighter this time, on middle and leg. Chamu flicks past short fine leg, to his left. Well played. Not a bad delivery at all either
good length on off, 131 kph. A bit of extra bounce and the ball bunts away towards cover. Plonky of the bat
excellent over for both parties. Keeps it close to off with a good length, blocked back to the bowler

ooh, 140 kph bouncer on off. Didn't intend that to get so high. Back of a length on off, Chari tries to get on top of the bounce to fend but the ball lobs through gully off the handle of the bat. Superb delivery. Extra oomph, bite and bounce from his height
nice stroke. Back of a length on off, punched to cover from the back foot. Transfer of weight onto the back foot
deviates back in. Good length on off, comes back in. Mis-timed push finds mid-on
good length on off, tapped by his feet into the off side and gets a positive response from Chari. Excellent run
back of a length on off, 143 kph. Blocked back.
back of a length on middle, worked to square leg for one
lovely stuff from Holder. Full on off, blocked back
a big appeal. Not given by umpire Shamsuddin. Full on off, but Chari gets forward and across, misses his block and is struck outside the line of off.
another good single. Back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
good length on a fourth-stump line. Left alone, confidently
leg side-ish this time, Chamu misses his flick and is hit on the pads down leg.
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover off the back foot
strays down leg this time, looking for the full length. Misses the pad, should have been called wide by Umpire Tiffin
full and wide outside off, fifth-stump line. The ball doesn't move, Chari is behind the line and creams his drive through the covers. Timed beautifully. No feet movement though
the natural reaction on middle and leg, a bouncer. Chari ducks
a back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, Chari reads it, gets forward and blocks
another bouncer on middle and leg, this is called wide. Too high, too leg side-ish. Take your pick
full and wide outside off, left alone. Well bowled. Well left.
full on off, comes back in. Defended
short and wide, too much width on this one. Chamu lays into his cut and scythes it through point. Nice timing, got on top of the bounce, found the gap. Check, check, check
poor ball, 129 kph. Goes down leg, Chamu nurdles this fine and gets four to fine leg. Short fine leg in place. Easy
leading edge and it lobs past cover. Full and straight, the ball may have straightened late. Chamu closes his bat face and gets a top edge which spoons to the left of cover
lovely delivery. Full outside off, 132 kph. Chari has covered the line by moving forward and across. The ball straightens and beats the bat
full outside off, blocked to cover
too wide outside off and comfortably left alone
another bouncer but this moves may down leg, wide, another one
146 kph, good length on middle and leg, shovelled into the leg side
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
lovely lines. Full and straight, and quick - 141 kph. Chamu hurries through his block
moves wider of the crease, brings this one back in - good length on off. Worked with the angle to midwicket
short and wide outside off, left alone. Sways out of the line
another back-of-the-hand slower ball, pushed with soft hands to mid-on for a comfortable run. Great batting
135 kph, too straight, worked to short fine leg
full outside off, pushed on the up but straight to a short cover
another slower ball, but this is full and straight. Chamu hammers his drive back past mid-off
full on off, dabbed towards point with soft hands. Well played again. Stunning discipline
full and straight, pushed out to mid-on. Calls for one immediately, makes it easily. Another good run.
full outside off, Chari is behind the line to defend
short and wide, slashed to point from the back foot
slowed up outside off, gets a hint of turn. Pushed back to the bowler with his feet stuck in the crease
driven to long-off with the little bit of turn
slower through the air on leg, worked to midwicket
flatter this time, full on leg. Chari misses his sweep and is struck on the pad.
driven to deep cover with a solid block through the line of the ball. Not a lot of turn so far

oh no. What a way to go. After all the hardwork. Chamu is run-out. A good length delivery outside off, dabbed towards the keeper. Chari is ball-watching and yells "noo", but with his back to Chamu. Could Chamu have not heard him because there was no eye contact. Chamu carries on, Chari doesn't leave. The keeper picks up and lobs the ball back to the bowler who runs Chamu out. That is not good from Chari. Has to look at his partner either way, if it is a run or not
good length outside off, dabbed out to point
a deft dab to third man. Got on top of the bounce
126 kph, angled away outside off. Ervine thinks of playing but withdraws his bat late
full and straight on off, blocked back
short and wide, slashed to point off the back foot
shorter, slower, on off. Chari pushes to cover off the back foot
shortish and wide outside off, cut to deep point off the back foot

a bit of turn. Slow through the air, but too straight. Nudged down to fine leg, makes use of the pace. Carter gets across and prevents the boundary with a well-timed dive. Quite normal for this generation of fielders
flat on off, not nearly short enough to cut but Chari goes back and cuts it off the stumps. Slashed past point for a couple to deep point. The pressure of a low strike rate getting to Chari
worked to point for a run
shortens the length on off, worked down to short fine leg with the angle

oh what a catch. Sensational stuff from Holder. The best catch I've seen this year. Wow. A full delivery on off and middle, the pressure on Chari was too much. He gets forward and heaves the ball in the air into the leg side. Holder hurtles back after it from short midwicket. Deep square leg is running in as well for the catch. He keeps an eye on both somehow. Keeps running back, and even as square leg is coming close to him, he keeps his eye on the ball and completes a stunning catch with both hands in front of him, diving to the ground as ball makes contact with his hands. Throws the ball up nonchalantly. More skill in these catches than reflex ones, meaning the difficulty level rises multi-fold.
good length outside off, moving away late. Beats the bat of Ervine's nothing stroke.
full delivery on off, moving away. Played to point
shortish and too wide, cut to deep point for one
quite full outside off, pushed away to the sweeper cover
quite full outside off, blocked to cover
driven to cover, who dives to his right and parries it to long-off
flight outside off, adjusts his length, pushes it wider. Defended
well played, gets to the ball which is outside off and drags his sweep through backward square leg for four. Well played. All along the ground
paddle-swept down to fine leg for one
flight outside off, squirted out to point
nice end. Tossed up on off and middle, blocked
full on off, pushed to mid-on
Ervien shuffles across, Brathwaite pushes it wider. Ervine has a waft and gets one to third man after the skew off the outside half
too straight, worked to deep square leg
lovely shot. Too full from Brathwaite, Ervine drives the ball with the full face of the bat past mid-off. Clean, lovely timing. Superb stroke
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
short on middle and leg, pulled down to fine leg for one

goes for a reverse sweep but it spins a little bit across him and misses and gets it off the pad behind square. But the umpire reckons there was an edge. It went just to the right of the keeper, who was a little late to react. But a tough chance nonetheless
pitched up ball on leg stump channel, clipped neatly off the toes to backward square leg
length ball outside off, comes forward and pushes at it with hard hands, gets it uppishly to the vacant covers region before it is fielded at sweeper cover
fuller on the fifth stump channel, blocked off the front foot back to the bowler
floated up and drifting in, gets down to sweep backward square leg
gives it some air outside off, driven off the front foot to sweeper cover
good length on the fourth or fifth stump channel, holding its line, Raza waits for it before steering it late to the left of backward point who dives to his left
fuller this time outside off, gets a good stride across and drives ot mid-off
good length and pushed across, gets it to jag away off the seam and Ervine is beaten as he sticks his bat out without feet
full and outside off, closes the face of his bat as he clips it from outside off through midwicket
very full on the corridor, tries to drill it through the off side but gets an inside edge and ends up dragging it back on to the pads
short ball, shapes up for the pull but it doesn't get up enough and he gets a bottom edge to the thigh guard
flighted length ball outside off, shuffles across to cover his off stump before punching it into the off side
pitched up outside off, comes forward and drives into the covers
gives it a lot of air and gets it slightly closer to the batsman outside off this time, Raza comes forward and eases it down to long-off
clipped off the pads to square leg
very full around off, drilled hard but straight to covers
gets it on a length after tossing it up outside off, does not turn much, Raza presses forward and punches it straight to cover

short of a length outside off that gets up on the batsman, Raza hops on to the backfoot and leans back slightly to ride the bounce before opening the face of his bat and steering it uppishly through the vacant cordon down to third man
full and on the pads, clipped off them to backward square leg

width on offer outside off, waits for it in the crease before opening the bat face and running it down to third man. Thinks of the second but it was hit rather straight to the fielder and there is no chance of the extra run
back of a length and pushed across outside off, punched solidly off the backfoot to covers
back of a length and width on offer outside off, runs it down to third man with an open bat face
tucked off the hips behind square
flighted and slides it in to the right-hander on the leg stump channel, defended back to the bowler
fires it in on leg and drags his length back slightly. Fine leg is inside the circle and Raza is able to shift back and tuck off the pads wide of the fielder there
short and wide, slapped square of the wicket
reverse sweep. It was pitched up and doesn't turn much, Ervine gets down low and comfortably works it to the right of short fine
clipped to midwicket
too wide outside off, needs to be pitching it up to bring the slip into play. This one is short and Raza is able to slap it square of the wicket to deep backward point

gets down to play the paddle sweep but gets it off the pad and the ball goes to fine leg. He had taken a big stride across before going down and so the ball hits him outside off and the appeal for lbw is turned down. West Indies have gone for a review, however. Seems to be a deflection, could have come off the glove. The on-field call stays
flighted and is the slot outside off, Raza drives hard just wide of mid-off who dives to stop the ball. Doesn't manage to stop it entirely though and the batsmen take a single
flatter and on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket off the front foot
full toss that's angling, gets down and sweeps behind square
gets down to sweep again and it's again pitched way up. The batsman meets the ball on the full and sweeps it just wide fine leg. Ervine calls for a quick single and they scamper back. Good running
blocked off the front foot into the off side
good length outside off, slaps it from the crease to backward point
short ball outside off, pulled from the fifth stump channel to deep midwicket
short and on leg stump, swivels around with the pull shot. Not much width, so he could not hit it too hard, just uses the pace on the delivery to guide it to fine leg
short ball outside off, jumps up to ride the bounce and uses his wrists on the pull to get it behind square leg to make sure he comfortably beats the fielder at deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
short of a length and angling across outside off, Ervine looks to run it down to third man but the ball gets up more than expected and he gets beaten
pitched up outside off, pushed in the air but well wide of the bowler as he uses his wrists and the ball goes to long-on
blocked off the front foot into the off side
backs away to make room and slashes at it to get it toward the third man fence, backward point chases it down and pulls it back
flat and on the leg stump, gets down to sweep but does not middle it, top-edges it but it goes very fine and he is sage
tries to slap this ball through the off side but there is not enough room as the ball spins back in. Raza ends up chopping on and the ball misses the stumps as it goes towards fine leg
full and wide, driven to long-off
short of a length ball, tucked off the hips towards midwicket, mid on runs across and picks it up
back of a length ball, looks to slap it away but inside-edges it to the thigh guard before the ball goes towards point
length ball, angling in on the pads, tucked to deep backward square leg
good length just outside off, defended solidly back down the pitch
short ball, angled across, it's way outside off and called a wide
good length and attacking the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
attacks the stumps with a fuller ball that is tucked away to midwicket for a single
flatter length ball outside off, presses forward and pushes it to long-off
flat and on a length outside off, looks to drop it in front of covers and steal a quick single but sent back by the non-striker
pushed down to long-on
flat and full on the stumps, not much turn, defended back to the bowler

advances down the ground to meet the pitch of this length ball, lack of turn affords him the luxury of doing so with minimum risk. Ervine lofts it over mid-on and the ball goes on the bounce over the boundary
driven into the off side
full, pacy delivery and on the pads, clipped behind square
sprays it on the pads again, clipped off the toes to backward square leg

a bit of width on offer outside off, Raza looks to steer it away to third man by opening the face of his bat but it doesn't bounce much as it was too full and he ends up chopping it on to the ground before the ball goes towards the wicketkeeper
short ball outside off, leans back to get out of the line of the delivery
full and just outside off, defended to the left of the bowler
tries to cut this wide ball but it doesn't get up much and he chops it on
flat and full outside off, defended into the covers
pitched up outside off, comes forward to meet the pitch before driving to extra cover
tries to cut upon seeing some width but it keeps a little low and he makes no contact
width on offer again, this time Ervine waits for it before steering it to third man
length ball on the stumps, no turn, presents the full face of his bat as he defends to the right of the bowler
blocked back to the bowler
short of a length, angled across, tucked off the hips to midwicket
short ball, angled down leg, ducked under
good length outside off, Raza presses forward and pushes it into the off side, between cover and point, they tak a single by the time point can run to his right and field it
fires it full just outside off, Ervine calmly blocks off the front foot into the off side
slightly short of a length and some width on offer outside off, waits for it before tapping it with an open face wide of backward point
short ball, angled in from outside off, not much pace on it, pulled quietly to square leg
flatter full ball outside off, comes down the track and drives to mid-off and comfortably takes the single
fuller on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
sees width on offer and cuts but chops it towards covers
flat, quick and outside off, Ervine tries to cut but the ball bounces past the edge and has the keeper momentarily excited but there was no bat involved
stays back to this length ball and knocks it off the inside part of the bat back to the bowler
good length ball, tucked with the inward angle to square leg
fuller outside off, driven to sweeper cover
good length ball that comes on at a comfortable pace, 128 kph, tucked off the hips to square leg and that brings up his fifty

that's the second time Raza has done it. It was a short ball and Raza hops back to ride the bounce and, seeing that there is a man at square leg, uses his wrists as he swivels around and pulls it to deep backward square leg

struck on the pad and Holder goes up on appeal but umpire Tiffin shakes his head. It was full and angling in and Raza was looking to clip it off the toes to the leg side. But he is a tad late in bringing his bat down and is struck on the pad. But that angle suggests it would have clearly headed down leg
yorker on the stumps, squeezed out down the pitch to the right of the bowler. Mid-on runs across and cuts it off but they have enough time to complete a comfortable single
length ball, goes down and sweeps to deep square leg
short and wide ball, tries to cut off the backfoot but can't pierce the gap
driven into the off side
short ball that is delivered at some pace, 85 kph outside off and gives Ervine enough room to pull it powerfully to deep midwicket
opens the face of his bat to steer it down to third man
clipped off the pads through midwicket
good length outside off, some away movement. 120 kph. Bunted to cover
a slow offcutter on off, pushed to cover from the crease.
goes straighter, stump to stump. Worked to midwicket. Three dot balls
there comes the pressure releasing stroke. Shimmies down and swats a short delivery to the deep midwicket boundary. Just sat up in the surface to hit. Shot
too straight and worked to deep square leg. These two have added 100, a mini-hug type thing between them
nudged to long-on. Placed in the gap at midwicket and the second is easily completed. Sensational batting
flat and full, drilled back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, driven to cover. Not much turn, so playing against it isn't that hard
flat on off, shovelled to deep midwicket
flat and straight, inside-edged to deep square leg and Raza has fifty. Really good knock this. Another mini-hug type thing
too full outside off, driven to mid-off for one.
short and wide outside off, slashed to point
a yorker outside off, slashed to point
lap swept away. Full length but outside off, Raza gets across and laps it away from an awkward position
shot. Full on off, and quick. Ervine gets low and sweeps the ball over short fine leg. Made use of the pace. Didn't bother keeping it down. There is that mini hug again
full on off and middle, driven to long-on. Great batting, making it look easy
back of a length outside off, Raza is beaten on his attempted dab because of some extra bounce
poor ball. Short and wide outside off, Raza uses the pace and width to steer his glide between short third man and point. Just astute batting, nothing flamboyant
driven with the spin, past short cover's right for a couple to deep cover. This pitch looks good for batting
slower outside off, driven to the sweeper cover
full and quick on off, worked to midwicket
uses his feet, comes down and drives back to the bowler
darted in on leg, Raza places this nicely, in front of square to gather a couple more. Nice
comes down and drills his drive past cover for another couple. These two looking for more now
shortish and wide outside off, mis-timed punch trickles to cover, enabling them to complete one
slower legcutter outside off, hammered to cover who dives to his left to stop the ball
four more. Brathwaite drops short, Raza picks the length and dispatches the ball to the midwicket boundary with an intentional lofted pull. Lovely execution, key was to know where the gap was
thwacked back. Full outside off, Raza gets across and gives it all he has. Long-off can't prevent two
overpitched on off, sweetly-timed but finds cover who dives to his right. Nice stop
slower ball outside off, slapped to point for a run
well done. Backed away very early, Nurse follows him. Raza then gets inside the line. WIde
quick down leg, off the pad to the keeper. Good take. An optimistic appeal
gets low and helps his sweep to deep backward square leg for a couple more. Nicely played
clean. Superb batting. Flat outside off, Raza opens the face and lofts the ball over cover with a nice lofted drive. An exhibition now from these two
shortish outside off, chopped to third man. Follows the boundary with one. Maturity
Ervine knows they've got plenty in this over so he nudges this towards midwicket for one
going down leg, would have been wide had Raza not got bat on that. Swept to deep backward square
good length on the fourth stump, 124 kph. Steered to point. Loud yelp of "nooooo"
a legcutter outside off, slashed to deep point off the back foot
mis-timed. Full on off, Ervine wnated to swat this over or through midwicket but the ball hurries onto him. Lobs towards mid-off

taken at long-off. Lovely shot but with the fielder there, it was always fraught with risk. Quite full outside off, Raza opens the face and lofts the ball with the full face of the bat. Goes very high, more elevation than distance. Kraigg Brathwaite moves across to his left, eyes on the ball at all times, and takes a good catch near his chest, juggled but job done. Superb knock from Raza
shortish on off, drag-pulled inside edge onto the pad for one towards square leg
another short ball ob middle, Williams pulls to deep backward square and forces Ervine back for the second. Played along the ground by rolling the wrists
slow and wide outside off, a bit of turn takes the ball past the outside edge
short and wide, slapped to deep cover for a couple more. Superb batting
dropped. Short and wide outside off, should have gone square but Ervine chooses to flat-bat his pull back to the bowler, who sticks out his right hand but can't cling on
worked to deep midwicket

given! Sean Williams misses his sweep and is struck in front of off. Shamsuddin's finger goes up almost as Nurse' appeal began. Williams doesn't bother reviewing because that looked rather plumb. It was full on off, maybe too full to be attempting that shot. Goes under the bat and Zimbabwe lose some momentum
fired in outside off, blocked
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
well bowled, slow through the air, gets some drift and spin as the ball beats the bat
short and wide, cut to deep point
fired in down leg, very quick. The keeper does well to prevent four more runs
pushed towards midwicket with the spin for a quick run
slowed up outside off, steered towards point who gets to his left and fires a terrible throw to the keeper. Overthrows. Long-on gets across to prevent five runs. Benn is bemused
flat on off, blocked back
yorker outside off, dug out back to the right of the bowler who runs across and fields it
angling in on the pads, tucks it to fine leg, thinks of a second but is denied
full ball on off stump, Chigumbura backs away and drives it powerfully to long-off
full and on the pads, clips it to the leg side and looks for a single but can't beat midwicket

full ball outside off, Ervine drives it wide of extra cover. Jonathan Carter dives and does well to get his hands to ball. Only problem is that he pushes it away as he dives and the ball changes direction and goes past the long-off fence
driven past extra cover to wide long-off
flighted full ball outside off, Chigumbura is happy to ease it down to long-off and turn the strike over
gives it too much air and bowls a full toss, Ervine gets down and swats it away to deep midwicket
very full ball on the stumps, tries to go for a slog sweep but gets it off the inside part of the bat to backward square leg
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to long-on
very full ball, gives it too much air outside off, Chigumbura advances down the track and almost yorks himself, manages to drill it wide of long-off
wide half-volley, tries to squeeze it out to third man but is late in bringing his bat down and does not make contact
clipped to midwicket
short ball, slower bouncer over leg stump, gets under it comfortably

goes for a wild slog and edges it to the wicketkeeper. It was a wide half-volley outside off. Chigumbura's front foot is way outside the line of the ball as he looks to make room and go big over the leg side. But Holder does well to take some pace off the ball and Chigumbura is through with the shot early. He wasn't anywhere near that in any case and gets an outside edge for his troubles and the wicketkeeper snaffles it
fuller ball outside off, leans forward and pushes it into covers

ooh, that one jags back in. It was a short of a length ball that gets up on the batsman. Moor tries to rock back and let it go but the ball spins back in like an off-break even as he dropping his wrists and hits something on it way to the wicketkeeper. They make a stifled appeal for a caught behind but ti looks like that went off the forearm
full and angling in on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
yorker on the stumps, Moor jams his bat down and digs it out back to the bowler
very full outside off, drills it to sweeper cover
cross-seam full delivery outside off, comes forward and drops it in front of cover for a single
short ball, fires this one at some pace, 136 kph and angles it in, Moor gets out of the line of the ball and is happy to let it go
goes for the yorker that angles in to the right-hander, but ens up firing a full toss. Moor backs away and swats it with a flat bat through long-off
low full toss outside off, whipped away to long-on
rolls his fingers over this back of a length ball outside off and takes the pace off it. Moor goes for a pull and does not make contact
very full ball outside off, doesn't find the middle of the bat and chops it into the ground as he drills it down to long-on
full and angling in on the pads, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg

oh, what a good catch! That was a short of a length ball and Moor was shaping for a pull shot. The ball nips back in late and he doesn't account for it, getting slightly cramped for room as a result. Gets a thick top-edge on the pull and the ball flies behind the stumps past the cordon and stays in the air for a long time. Rovman Powell at backward point runs across a long way and puts in the dive to take an extremely tough catch
full and on the stumps, hits it straight down the ground and follows it up with a lovely follow-through of the bat
clipped to midwicket

and another one goes and this is a huge wicket. It's Ervine who falls eight short of a century. It was a full ball on the leg stump channel and Ervine looked to turn it away to the leg side. But the ball stops on him a bit and he goes through with the flick early as a result. Does not find the middle of the bat and sends it in the air and Powell, running in from long-on, snaffles it at midwicket
short ball, goes up on hi toes to ride the bounce before dropping it in front of backward point for a single
short of a length ball outside off, takes the pace off with a legcutter, pulled away to long-on
very full ball outside off, tries to drill it through the off side but can't get his bat down in time
full and outside off, slashes hard at it and gets an outside edge that goes on the bounce to short third man

full and on the pads, knocks it towards mid-on. There is nobody there, so the bowler has to run back and chase it down. They take him on and scamper back for a quick second and easily beat the throw at the non-striker's end
tries to flick it to the leg side but gets it off the leading edge back to the bowler
off-cutter outside off, flat-bats it hard to long-on
back of a length outside off, punches it off the backfoot wide of sweeper cover. Take on the fielder again and hurry back for the second run. Good running
driven through extra cover
yorker on leg stump, Tiripano was making room and jams his bat down to keep it out
short ball, stopping on the batsman again and Tiripano doesn't get enough power on the pull. Gets it to long-on on the bounce

comes down the ground and makes room as he does so. A bit pre-meditated but that ball landed right where he wanted it to. On a length and angling in to him so he can get near it and whack it clean over long-on. And that is Zimbabwe's highest ODI total this year
tucked to backward square leg

short, legcutter outside off. It's very wide and Cremer can't get to it though he walks a long way across and tries to pull. The ball goes towards the wicketkeeper and they think of a non-existent single before deciding against it. Way outside off and called a wide
low full toss outside off, driven to long-off

goes for a slog and misses, Gabriel hits. It was full and angling in. Tiripano takes an almighty swipe, perhaps needed to make a bit of room to execute it properly. He doesn't do so and makes no contact with the ball which crashes into the leg stump
fuller ball on off stump, looks to drive but mistimes it back to the bowler
hits the blockhole on middle and leg, Cremer does well to drill it down the pitch to the right of the bowler, but Brathwaite dives to his righ and fields it cleanly

full toss from Brathwaite, Cremer gets down to paddle sweep. The surface is slow and there isn't too much pace, so he doesn't get the ball as far as he would have liked. It lobs straight to the fielder at short fine leg
yorker on off, digs it out back to the bowler
fuller ball, angling in on off, whips it through midwicket for a brace to a loud cheer from the crowd
cleaned him up. Full and straight. Mpofu goes for the slog but it is too straight and he makes no contact. The ball crashes into middle stump and spilts it into two

inn2.comm: slingy wide delivery outside off and left alone. Gets a bit of swing, maybe because of that angle
good length outside off, steered down to third man from the crease
good length outside off, Brathwaite drops down towards cover and sets off, gets a run easily
too straight from Mpofu. Good length on middle and leg, nudged down to short fine leg
more away movement with that round-arm action. Shortish and wide, slashed to point
brings this one back in with a 125 offcutter on off and middle, worked towards midwicket
good length outside off, a bit of away movement. Blocked into the off side
lovely channel, close to off, worked away towards midwicket
short and wide, terrible delivery. Slow. Brathwaite scythes his cut behind point for four. Really went after that
good length outside off, 132 kph. A bit of away movement, pushed towards cover
well played. Back of a length outside off, Brathwaite opens the face and works the ball through square leg for a couple.
rather full on off, a bit of away movement. Played back
good length outside off, pushed out towards mid-off from the crease
an offcutter, a short offcutter on off. Swivel-pulled to deep backward square leg for a couple more.
six! Too full from Mpofu, Charles lofts the ball cleanly over mid-on. Got sufficiently underneath that, made good contact and it just about cleared the long-on boundary. Sweet timing
back of a length down leg, nudged to short fine leg. A quick run from Brathwaite, had judged it superbly
full on off, worked to midwicket, 133 kph
another cutter, 125 kph, on off or just outside. Worked to midwicket with the angle
short on off, a drag pull to short fine leg. Inside-edged to short fine leg
good length on a fifth-stump line, Brathwaite uses his wrists to flick towards midwicket
the pacers already using pace variations on this surface. Slow on off, 116 kph, blocked back
131 kph, good length on middle and leg, worked to square leg
full outside off, shovelled into the leg side
short and wide outside off, slashed down to third man. Too much width offered

good length on middle and leg, worked to square leg. Plenty of hesitation, Brathwaite goes through with the run. Ervine is quick on the ball and effects a direct hit at the bowler's end but Brathwaite is safe. He is really quick, something we haven't seen too much with in Tests. The ball ricochets away for an overthrow
good length outside off, dabbed to gully
too straight again, worked down towards fine leg
pummelled through to deep square leg. Good length outside off, Charles stays in his crease and swats it away
offcutter outside off, nudged to midwicket
another offcutter outside off, pushed to extra cover's left who fumbles while diving to allow the extra run
124 kph, full on middle, nudged to midwicket
good length outside off, played towards extra cover for one, but Charles sends him back because the fielder is quick to the ball
too full this time, worked down to fine leg
shot! Too straight from Tiripano, worked through to midwicket
cutter outside off, Charles opens his bat face to guide it down to third man for one
another cutter on off, blocked back towards mid-on
shortish delivery on off, Charles swats his pull on the bounce to midwicket. Mis-timed
a tad too full on off, Charles lofts the ball with plenty of bottom-handed power, gets it wide of long-on for a couple
too straight this time, nudged down to the fine leg boundary. Easy. Poor ball from Mpofu
shortish and very wide outside off, Charles mis-times his slap into the off side. Not suitable to cross-batted stroke-making this surface
good length on middle and leg, Charles misses a flick and is struck rather high on the body
shortish delivery on off, a cross-batted swat finds midwicket. Very quick on that stroke
another leg side-ish delivery, worked to fine leg
excessively full on the pads, sliding down. Big appeal from Tiripano but that was always missing the stumps. Charles beaten on his flick by the fullness of the length

that is a lot closer and given by umpire Tiffin. Charles wants the review. An offcutter that pitches outside off, that has come back some way and struck Charles in front of middle and leg. No bat on that. The only question is if it is missing the stumps entirely. Not a terrible review. But He'll have to go because the ball is just about clipping leg stump. A good knock but beaten by the slowness this time. Just missed a flick
full length outside off, left alone
full on off, 128 kph, pushed to mid-off. Zimbabwe using all sorts of variations, particularly with pace. Good bowling
too much width on that occasion. Overpitched and hammered through extra cover. Lovely timing
shortish and wide, slapped to point. Another poor delivery, too much width
offcutter on off, worked to midwicket. Knew exactly how hard he had hit that and called for one immediately
too much width again from Mpofu. In fact, it is not legal, the umpire calls it a wide
slower delivery, good length on middle and leg. Lewis intentionally lofts the ball over square leg and gets four.
strays down leg this time. Wide called, another one. Some byes too as the keeper can't collect
good length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
slower ball on middle and leg, played into the leg side
good length on middle and leg, worked through to square leg
drifts down leg, poor bowling this. Another free run for WI
pathetic stuff. Goes around the wicket and bowls it into the pads, Lewis lofts his flick over short fine leg for four. Easy
full on middle and leg, too full I'd way, muscularly drilled to mid-on
Lewis now weathers an lbw shout. Tiripano hits Lewis on the pad with a cutter, but this pitched well outside leg
length and outside off, chopped behind to the keeper
fractionally and just outside off, does not come onto the left-hander. Lewis pulls off the splice, in the air to the left of mid-on. He wasn't in control of it, having played early
seam-up, good length on off, Lewis is happy to hang back and punch it down to mid-off
full, tossed up, hint of turn away from Brathwaite, who drives it to extra cover
digs it short and outside off, cut away on the back foot. Raza throws himself to his right and makes a smart stop at backward point
quick fizzer, angling away outside off, left alone
slides away outside off with the angle no turn, flatter, slash and a miss
full on middle and leg, keeps low, whipped to midwicket on the back foot
slower through the air, angled in on off, defended to the covers

oh, dear! What has Lewis done here. It was a loosener from Cremer, short and spinning in slightly. Right in the slot for Lewis to dispatch it out of the ground. He sets himself up and gets in position early before nailing a muscular pull. But out of all the vast ares in the leg side field, he picks out deep square leg and sends it straight down his throat as Chibhabha latches on to it just before the boundary. Didn't have to move an inch
short ball, pulled along the ground between midwicket and long-on
shorter again, tucked off the hips to square leg
pitched up on the stumps, Hope presses forward and blocks
loopy delivery that is drifting down leg and spins away, clipped to the leg side
punched off the backfoot through covers
length ball, spinning away, stays back and defends
sliding on with the arm on a length, eased down to long-on
back of a length on the stumps, tucked off the pads between midwicket and square leg
full and wide outside off, has to reach out for it but goes after it nonetheless and crunches a drive square of the wicket
presses forward and blocks to mid-off
floated up and sliding down leg, eased down to long-on
gives it a lot of air and slides it down leg, almost hits the blockhole, squeezed out to the left of the bowler
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
tries to flick it to the leg side and gets it off the leading edge back to the bowler
pitched up on the stumps, pushed to mid-off
nudged to the leg side
length ball outside off, punched to point
full and sliding on with the arm on leg stump, pushed to long-off
flat and short of a length, slapped off the backfoot to point where a misfield allows the ball to sneak through. Poor fielding
tossed up on off, driven towards mid-off, but Raza at extra cover flings himself to his right to stop it
fuller ball, comes forward and drives through extra cover
short and wide, cut powerfully to sweeper cover
flat short of a length ball outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
full ball on the stumps, clipped off the toes to long-on
googly. Floated up outside off, Hope shifts back and looks to open the face of his bat but it spin the other way and he makes no contact
full and outside off, driven through covers
width on offer outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
what a ball! Gives it some air on leg stump and Hope stays back to the length ball. The ball spins viciously and past the outside edge as Hope is beaten on the attempted backfoot push
flat back of a length ball, tucked off the pads behind square
short and wide, cuts and backward point puts in the dive, pushes it slightly away and that allows the run to be taken
straight ball on off, no turn, defended back to the bowler
tossed up on off, driven straight back to the bowler who messes up a simple stop as the ball its his wrists and bounces away
comes forward and blocks
length ball, clipped shorter ball, does't get hold of the pull and skews it to long-on
loopy delivery on leg stump, presses forward and blocks to the bowler
comes down the track and looks to loft this over the off side after getting to the pitch of the ball, but gets it off the inside part of the bat to wide long-on
nudged to midwicket
tucked to deep midwicket

stumping chance, referred upstairs. That was pushed through quicker outside off and spins away. Hope is drawn forward and loses balance as he swings hard looking to go over the off side. Ends up dragging his backfoot out of the crease and the wicketkeeper takes the bails off. But replays confirm that he was abl to comfortably slide his foot back in, well before the bails were knocked off
length ball, sliding in on leg, tucked between mid-on and midwicket
pushed through on leg at a flat trajectory, nudged to the on side
flighted on leg, driven inside-out to sweeper cover

ooh, that one spun sharply. Looks like Zimbabwe may go for a review, and they do. It was a good length ball that pitches around middle and spins past the batsman's front foot push and pings him on the back pad. Height may be an issue there as it bounced. Replays show that ball has spun enough to take out only the outer half of the off stump, so the on-field call remains
knocked to long-on
fuller ball, presses forward and drops it in front of covers and takes off for a quick single
short ball, gets up at a comfortable height for Hope who swivels around with the pull shot as the ball gos to deep square leg

this one's even better. Too short again and this time it pitches on leg and spins back away. Hope seems like he was ready for it for eternity. Shapes up to get in good position before timing the pull to perfection
full toss outside off, chips the drive to short extra cover
tucked to square leg
flat length ball on the stumps, tucked to fine leg
pitched up on leg, defended off the front foot into the off side
tucked off the pads to midwicket
flat length ball that spins away sharply, stays back and knocks it back to the bowler
sliding in with the arm on leg stump, places it perfectly between midwicket and long-on for a brace
good length, coming in from outside off, blocked to the off side
short and wide, slapped away square of the wicket
pushed through quicker on the pads, at 90kph, driven down to long-on
fuller ball, comes forward and pushes it to covers
very full on the stumps, drilled back to the bowler
flat and on a length, defended to the off side off the front foot
good length on middle and leg and spinning away, defended to mid-on
sliding on with the arm on off and middle, looks to drive but inside-edges it to the pads
back of a length, comes in with the angle from around the wicket, no turn, defended to the leg side
short of a length, close to off stump and spinning away, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
fuller ball, comes forward and pushes it to the left of the bowler who dives but can't stop it. Mid-off dives but can't get to the ball either
clipped to square leg
pitched up outside of, no turn, driven to sweeper cover
nudged to midwicket
pushed through quicker, 97 kph, and attacking the stumps, knocks it back to the bowler off the front foot
length ball, Hope is pushed to the backfoot and defends it to point
short and wide outside off, waits for it and uses the pace on the ball - it's a quicker one - before just placing it between cover-point and backward point
compensates for it by pitching it up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
pushed back to the right of the bowler who gathers it on the follow-through
uses the width on offer to slap it to sweeper cover
meets the pitch of the ball before drilling it to the left of the bowler who dos not manage to stop it entirely and lets the ball get away
ooh, some turn and pace as well. Hope hangs on the backfoot and sticks his bat out to this back of a length ball but is beaten comprehensively as the ball turns sharply past the outside edge
knocks it back towards the bowler
blocks it down the pitch off the front foot
comes forward and drives to extra cover
defended off the backfoot to cover
back of a length, stopping on the batsman, looks to punch it to covers but does not middle it
drifting in, looks to sweep and the ball lobs off the top-edge to fine leg
shifts back to the backfoot and looks to flick but the ball hits him on the pad. Appeal for lbw but it probably was missing leg. Replays show that the ball would have hit leg stump
punched to long-off
full and outside off, driven to long-off
looks to tuck off the pads but can't beat short fine leg
full and wide outside off, crunches a drive to sweeper cover
flat and back of a length, slapped off the backfoot to sweeper cover
pushed towards mid-off before the bowler darts across to gather it
tucked off the pads to square leg, calls for a quick second and comes charging back to beat th throw
full and on leg stump, eased down to long-on
flat and sliding in with the arm on a short of good length, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, comes forward to defend but it turns slightly more than anticipated and he gets it off the splice to short third man
tossed up on off, steered towards point
flat on off, pushed with the little bit of spin to long-off. Nicely hit, full face of the bat
too straight, Brathwaite works his nudge to short fine leg. Missed out a run
flatter, quicker, fuller. Nudged to midwicket with the angle
flat, goes on with the arm. No turn. Hits Hope on the pad down leg. Hurries for pace
lot of flight this time, good change. Worked to deep point, who fumbles and allows the second run.
shortish on middle, cut to point from the stumps
short and wide, slapped to deep cover
lots of flight, Hope opens the face of the bat and guides to deep cover. Well played
flat on off, quick. Blocked into the off side
85 kph, quiker again, prodded into the off side. Another dot, these building up
another one, slow on middle, kept out
overpitched outside off, hit to cover who misfields and allows an extra run
worked to midwicket from the straight line
flatter and quicker, Hope goes back to something he should have been forward to, driven to cover
worked to midwicket again. Three dot balls in a row
shimmies down and nudges to midwicket. Four on the trot
flat on leg, clipped to deep midwicket this time to get the run he needed to get to fifty.
shortish on off, spinning away but Hope punches to long-on with a swat
shortish on middle, pulled to square leg who fumbles while releasing
wristily flicked to long-on. Full enough to play against the turn
84 kph, full on leg, driven back to the bowler
short and wide again, slashed to deep point for one. Too much width
pitches on middle and leg, spins towards outside off, flicked to square leg, had to drag that
short, long-hop. Hope picks the length early, hurries back and swats his pull over square leg. Superb shot, went deep in the crease and opened his stance to ease the execution
shortish and leg side-ish, swivel-shovelled down to fine leg
flat on the pads, worked down to fine leg
flat on off, worked to midwicket from the back foot.

lovely use of the feet, gets to the pitch and lofts it straight. He did not get it off the middle though. It skewed off the inside half. Tiripano is patrolling the boundary, takes a good overhead catch but steps on the boundary as he takes it. Unfortunate for the fielder, great effort
driven back to the bowler
flat outside off, cut to deep cover
tossed up on off, played towards point
lots of air and loop on that, calmly driven with the spin to long-off
too straight, nudged towards square leg
executed a fine paddle sweep. Got low and just got a deft touch on that. Well played
superb. Tossed up on off, Hope goes after a drive through cover, not long-off The ball rips and beats the bat. Lovely trajectory from the leggie
flat on off, played back
overpitched outside off, driven to cover
quick on off, blocked. Too many dot balls from Brathwaite, building pressure
flat on off, worked to midwicket. Four in four
almost hits leg stump. Darted in on leg, Brathwaite sweeps, flicks the glove and hit the side of the base of leg stump. The bails did not move
played into the leg side
tossed up on off, driven back to the bowler
shortish and wide, scythed to point. Another dot
dropped. A simple catch. Low full toss outside off, hammered but straight to Raza at cover who gets his hands up by his hips, the ball bursts through
pushed in front of cover, wanted one but Raza is quick on the ball
cut to the sweeper cover
nicely tossed up outside off, pushed down to long-off. Hit with the spin.
flat on middle and leg, played into the leg side
excellently played. Sees a gap behind point, gets low and uses deftness to gather a boundary to third man. A fine reverse sweep. Well played
worked towards the bowler who dives to his right to save one
fired in on off, pushed to long-off
flat on middle, worked to short fine leg with the angle for one. Still, just six off it
flat and wide outside off, slashed to deep point
too short again, carved to deep point with a cut
tossed up on leg, clipped to midwicket. Brathwaite gets to fifty, a good knock but has it taken up too many balls?
tossed up on off, Hope opens the face and guides towards point
flat on off, 87 ks. Pushed through. Played out, jammed out. Well bowled, beat the batsman in flight
flatter but slower on leg, a thick inside edge to fine leg
oh shot. Not a bad ball at all. Flat delivery on off, some spin. Brathwaite goes back and pulls past midwicket. Fantastic stroke
slow on off, blocked
another flat delivery outside off, Brathwaite makes room and slashes to deep point
lovely flight on off, Hope angles his bat, opens the face late to find the gap through extra cover. Lovely ODI stroke
worked away to midwicket
tossed up on leg, blocked
short and wide outside off, carved to deep cover for one
slog-swept for six. Lovely shot from Hope. Tossed up on middle and off, Hope gets down, close enough to the pitch and out comes the big slog sweep. Heaved for six over midwicket
slowed up outside off, tapped to point

one shot too many. Was always long-off's catch. Raza is the better fielder, thinks he can take it, which is goof self-confidence but was never his catch. Hope goes fore the slog sweep, skied to long-off who had to run in. But Raza runs back from short cover, calls for the catch and hardly gets a hand on it. Another opportunity gone
short on off, pulled to wide mid-on for one
flat on off, Brathwaite comes down and drives to cover on the bounce. Umpire Shamsuddin has one hand outstretched, calls a no-ball. Zimbabwe had five out. Sloppy stuff
Brathwaite rushes down to the pitch, lofts his drive over cover for a couple. Darted in outside off
flat down leg, pulled towards backward square leg
tossed up outside off, carved to deep cover. Again, opens the face to manufacture a run. Well played
flat and wide from over the wicket, left alone
short and wide, slapped to deep cover
full and wide, carved to deep point for one
short and wide ball, slapped away to deep backward point
angling in from outside off, worked to point
very full, straight ball on off, drilled back towards the bowler
fires it full and angles it in, eases it down with the angle to long-on
short of a length, just outside off, waits for it before opening the face of his bat to steer it down to third man
ooh, jags back in late and misses everything. It was on a length and Hope was on to the front foot but the nips back in. Not the toughest of takes for the wicketkeeper but it goes through nonetheless
floated up outside off but gives too much width. Hope gleefully accepts it and slashes it hard through square third man
comes forward and drives to sweeper cover
short of a length ball, not much turn, swivels around as he tucks it away but midwicket makes a diving stop
hangs back and cuts this short of a length ball but can't get it past the fielder at backward point
straight length ball just outside off, not much turn, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
short ball, bowls it straight and on the stumps this time, gets up at a comfortable height, pulled away to deep midwicket

back of a length on the fourth-stump channel, slaps it past the diving cover fielder and the ball goes to the deep. Two fielders close in and the man at sweeper cover gets around it and picks it up. And that will be the 150 of the partnership
slapped from the crease to deep backward point
well-done by the bowler. Hope backs away early to make room but the bowler follows him and fires it on leg stump channel, Hope runs it away to backward point
short, slow bouncer on leg. Hope misses and the ball goes through Moor's legs

comes down the track to this length ball and Brathwaite swats it to mid-on where Tiripano fails to make a simple stop. The ball runs away towards the long-on fence but Tiripano manages to pull himself back well and chases it before pulling it back just as it is about to cross the ropes. They, in fact, go upstairs to check and after a long look, the third umpire decides it is fine
short and wide, tries to cut but gets cramped for room and is beaten
drives it to point and thinks of a single. a bit of a yes-and-no and Hope takes off for the run. He is sent back and puts in the dive and is safe in the end
flighted on middle, pushed off the front foot to the bowler
short of a length, tucked off the pads to midwicket
comes down the track a step before slapping it through extra cover
short ball, tries to pull and gets it off the bottom edge to fine leg

and that is his maiden century, in his second game. Becomes the quickest his first hundred for West Indies.Coming to the delivery, it was a length ball and Hope comes down the track before whipping it through midwicket
short ball, tries to hook but the bounce is too steep and the ball goes to the wicketkeeper

comes down the track and looks to slog across the line and edges to the keeper. It was a pre-meditated move and the bowler makes the adjustment by firing it on a length and taking it away from him outside off. Hope goes through with his shot early and the ball goes off the splice to the wicketkeeper. He is livid, as he should be, for having given it away. Had the chance to see his team through
short ball, Powell does well to roll his wrists over the pull to backward square leg

backs away to make room. Mpofu follows him with a short ball on the leg stump. Cuts the pace on this delivery, so Brathwaite is through with the pull shot early and gets struck on the hip as he swivels around
length ball, attacking the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, no turn, stays on the backfoot and punches it back to the bowler
straight length ball outside off, goes for a mighty heave and makes no contact. 37 from 27 needed and West Indies could start feeling the nerves now. This one isn't over yet
flat ball outside off, goes for a slog and gets an outside edge just wide of short third man who makes a good stop
lucky. Comes down the track and looks for a slog, gets it off the edge past short third man. The ball is racing away to the boundary, but Elton Chigumbura charges back and does well to pull it back
tucked to midwicket
short ball, pulled away to backward square leg
backs away to make room but Mpofu makes the adjustment and takes it away from him outside off , leaving Brathwaite to make an awkward attempt at a slap and he doesn't make contact
stays leg side of the ball and exposes his stumps. It's back of a length and Brathwaite flays it through extra cover
full and on the pads, Powell picks it up off the pads and heaves it behind square as the ball goes on the bounce to deep fine leg
short of a length delivery, Brathwaite gets leg side of the ball and responds with a flat-batted whip straight past the bowler who gets down but can't stop it. The ball goes to long-off

well-directed short ball, Powell swings hard and gets the pull off the top edge past the leaping wicketkeeper to the fine leg fence. It was well over the keeper, so was never a chance. But a lucky boundary nonetheless

and Brathwaite's stubborn resistance comes to an end. He comes down the track and looks to go over long-off. But the ball isn't quite full enough and he does not get to the pitch of it. Lofts it straight down after making room but doesn't get it off the middle and hits it straight down the throat of long-off who snaffles it without discomfort. Everybody at the ground rejoices. Could there be a late twist to this?
flat ball outside off, comes forward and thumps it over long-off. That was a clean hit, powerfully struck
went for a pull shot to this short ball but gets the timing wrong and skews it uppishly straight down the pitch

oh, bowled him, and more drama ensues. It was a nothing shot, really. He made room and looked to swipe across the line to the leg side but seemed like a lazy shot. Credit to the bowler though for attacking the stumps and bowling a near-yorker. Powell can't make bat meet ball which crashes into the atumps
ooh, almost. Looks for a flick and closes the face of his bat and ends up chipping it straight back just over the bowler who is unable to get to it. But that was mighty close
tucked to midwicket
short of a length ball, pulls it but there is a man at deep midwicket and it will just be one
short and wide, looks to back away and cut but there wasn't too much pace on that delivery, just 125 kph. Doesn't bounce much as well and Holder does not make contact
short of a length, fetches it from outside off and swats it away to deep midwicket
short ball, it was another slower bouncer and Brathwaite can't get hold of the pull shot. Gets it off the top edge and on the bounce to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, Holder swats it with a flat bat to long-off. 10 needed from 7 now. Can West Indies get a boundary to bring it down to run-a-ball in the last over?

oh, yes, they can. Too predictable from Mpofu. Started off with intelligent variations in pace but resorted to the slower ball tactic too often. It was another slow and short ball but this time Brathwaite wouldn't be foxed. Was waiting for it and lays into the pull shot as the ball soars over the deep midwicket fence. Deathly silence at the ground
fuller ball outside off, drills it to sweeper cover. Singles will do it for West Indies

kind of a needless shot with three needed off five. It was a slower ball from Tiripano. Legcutter on a length and Brathwaite tries to swat it with a flat bat. It was a low percentage shot and he skews it to long-on, much to the delight of a large section of the crowd

oh, what terrible luck. Run out at the non-striker's end. It was a fuller ball and Holder makes good connection on the forward push and the ball goes on the bounce towards the bowler who tries to stop it with outstretched hands. But it goes off the finger and crashes into the stumps with Nurse out of the crease as he was backing away. What drama!
back of a length, outside off, looks to play across the line but it brushes the thigh and goes fine of short third man

chance at deep square leg, did it carry to Chibhabha? It was a legcutter on a short of good length and Carter pulls it. It seems like it carried to the fielder who makes a brilliant effort s he dives forward. Unfortunately for Zimbabwe, he does not manage to grab it. But a superb effort as he did not allow the ball to go to the boundary. Those catches are always tricky and it is easy to miss the catch and let the ball escape from in between. Scores level now.

unbelievable scenes at Queens. What a match! Zimbabwe are leaping in joy an why wouldn't they! This has been a remarkable fightback. But let's not forget to give credit to the bowler. What a superb delivery under pressure. Fires it very full and outside off, just around the line forcing the batsman to reach out. Holder can't make contact but Carter sets off for the run from the non-striker's end. The wicketkeeper has a shy at the stumps and Carter is caught short. An inch outside and it could have been a wide. A perfect last delivery and full marks to Tiripano
